text: EVAN, 20, good-looking but with dark haunted eyes, franti hides himself in an unlit Doctor's office. His face and c are covered in blood. He holds his forehead in pain. FLASHLIGHT BEAMS stab through the darkened corridor hunti for him. ALARMS SOUND. GUARDS are heard shouting to each  other. Evan grabs a cardboard box and hides under a docto desk. He grabs some paper and begins writing in shorthand
(as he writes) If anyone finds this, then I guess  my plan didn't work and I'm already  dead...
He takes a deep breath.
But if I can just go back to the  beginning of all this, I still might  be able to save her.
Fatigue overwhelms him, but he continues writing...

ANDREA TREBORN, twenty-five, an attractive pregnant woman strapped to a gurney, is rolled down a busy hospital corr She is clearly ready to give birth, and as she flails her arms, she knocks another patient's IV bottle into the wal
A tearful Andrea holds newborn EVAN in her hands.
Smiling Andrea holds baby Evan up to the camera, then pla him in a crib.
A playground. Evan's father, JASON (23), puts a 1-year ol on a slide.

A birthday party for LENNY, 5, a chubby kid with only a f friends. Evan, now 5, is gently prodded by Andrea toward  KAYLEIGH, 5, a quiet sweet-looking girl with beautiful ha Evan clumsily shakes her hand and she quickly leans over kisses his cheek. He blushes and runs to hug his mother's leg. END MONTAGE & TITLES.

In the driveway, 7-year old Evan plays with CRICKETT, a f cocker spaniel puppy. Andrea, wearing a mechanic's jumpsuit, works impatiently the carburetor of a Toyota Celica. Evan pets the dog as h watches his mother work.
Okay, okay... what now?
Evan quickly eyes the situation and grabs the 5/16" wrenc from the toolbox.
We're gonna be late again.
When did you ever care about getting  to school on time?
We're putting up pictures for Parent's  Night.
Evan impatiently watches Andrea turn the bolt.
Righty-tighty, lefty-lucy.
Thanks. Don't worry Evan, you'll  have plenty of time.
The carburetor will not set properly. She bangs on it wit the wrench.
(re: carb) Darn it!
Um... can dad come this time?
(getting impatient) You know the answer to that.
Can't he come out for one day?
We've been over this a hundred times.  It's too dangerous for him.
But Lenny said that his dad's  coming... and Tommy and Kayleigh's  dad...
Andrea hands the wrench to Evan.
Here, Ev... Finish this up for me.
Evan beams as he climbs onto the bumper and screws the ca back together. Andrea, meanwhile, strips off her coveralls, revealing a  spotless nurse's uniform underneath.
All the dads are gonna be there.
I get the point, kiddo. But I'm not  so bad, am I?
No.
Good. Because I've been waiting to  see your art projects all week and  I'd feel terrible if all you thought  about was your father not being there.
Evan, disappointed, passes the wrench back to Andrea.
(beat) Done. Try it.
Andrea gets behind the wheel. She turns the ignition and engine roars to life. Evan wears a proud smile.
You're amazing, kiddo.
Andrea races through the school zone and heads for the ma doors. Evan's already got the car door open and his foot the ground by the time the car skids to a halt. Andrea ch her watch.
Okay have a great day I love you  I'll pick you up later gotta go...
Evan blows Andrea a kiss goodbye and runs into the school As Andrea pulls away, MRS. BOSWELL, 35, taps the car wind
Mrs. Treborn! I need to speak with  you!
I'm sorry, but can it wait til  tonight? I'm already late for work --
Mrs. Boswell's morbid expression stops Andrea.
I think you really need to see this.

The classroom is filled with screaming, running children. Mrs. Boswell enters the classroom with Andrea and immedia calls out to TOMMY, a tough seven-year old kid who swings whiffle bat at LENNY, now seven, a sniffling, chubby kid.
TOMMY! LEAVE LENNY ALONE! DON'T MAKE  ME SEND YOU TO MR. VOYTEK'S OFFICE!
Evan is surprised to see his mother enter with Mrs. Boswe but continues playing with Kayleigh, now seven, a quiet,  sweet-looking girl. Mrs. Boswell leads Andrea over to the teacher's desk.
I was going to show this to the  principal, but I wanted to talk to  you first.
What is it?
Yesterday I had all the children  draw pictures of what they wanted to  be when they grew up. Most of them  made drawings of what their parents  did, but this...
Mrs. Boswell opens the bottom drawer of her desk and pull out a drawing. Andrea turns to stone when she sees it.
I don't understand... Evan did this?

The drawing shows a child holding a bloody knife while  standing on a heap of dead bodies. It's extremely  sophisticated for a seven-year old. Some of the corpses h been cut open and the insides are surprisingly anatomical correct. Andrea sees Evan playing with Lenny, harmless as a bunny, and struggles to control her concern.
Thank you for showing it to me first.  I'll... I'll take care of it. Can I  have the picture?
Of course. There is one more thing,  Mrs. Treborn. And I feel bad for  mentioning it...
What?
When I asked Evan about his drawing,  well, he didn't remember doing it.
Andrea is visibly shaken now.
I have to go.
Andrea seems so impacted by this revelation that she cann even start the car.

The children hang artwork on the walls in prep for Parent Night. Each child has a picture of his or her family made from colored construction paper and macaroni. Evan's pict (no longer sophisticated) depicts his mother, Crockett an himself on a green hill. Tommy and Kayleigh's pictures ea show two kids and a single father. And their 'mother' is  stuck to the far end of page. Lenny beams as he pins-up his picture of an ideal nuclear family. He looks at Tommy's picture and is confused.
You put the mommy too far away. Mrs.  Boswell has macaroni and glue if you  wanna fix it.
You're such a retard!
Mommy lives far away but she comes  and visits.
(to Tommy) If I'm retarded, why didn't my mommy  move away from me?
Tommy gets upset. He swipes his hand down Lenny's picture and his macaroni "mother" crumbles to the floor. Lenny be to cry.
Hey, what'd you do that for?
Fat little baby, crying for mommy.
Evan takes the ruined picture and leans down next to Lenn
Come on, Lenny. It's not that bad.  You can still see your mom a little.

Lenny, unable to stop crying, begins hyperventilating out control. His desperate gasps for breath are frightening. Evan, scared, looks around for Mrs. Boswell, but cannot f her. He reaches up to his own picture and quickly tears h own macaroni "mother" apart and places it over Lenny's  picture. It's a nuclear family again. Lenny slowly is abl to catch his breath.
(grateful) Can... can... Can I have this?
Sure. I was gonna make a new one,  anyway.

Kayleigh helps Lenny glue a new "mother" in place and she smiles gratefully at Evan. As Evan smiles back at Kayleigh, Mrs. Boswell calmly ente the room in time to see Evan tacking up his butchered fam portrait. She shivers.
Gothic. Imposing. Andrea runs up the stairs.
DR. HARLON REDFIELD, 40, a handsome and extremely genial  man, scrutinizes a disturbing drawing.
And you say he doesn't remember any  of it?
(anxious) Not according to his teacher. It  just got me thinking about Jason and  what if Evan's inherited his father's  condition?
Hold it, hold it, Andrea. Let's not  jump to conclusions. I'll run some  preliminary tests, see what we can  rule out.
Andrea nods and forces a thankful smile.
Tell you what, bring Evan here tonight  and we'll run a CAT-scan series.
The looming building looks even more frightening at night Andrea and Evan head up the stairs.
I don't like this place, Mom. It's  creepy. Please can we go? I promise  I won't make any more bad pictures!
(lighthearted) You'll be fine. Dr. Redfield just  wants to give you some tests. You'll  like him.
Andrea leads Evan into Dr. Redfield's office. Dr. Redfiel warmly greets Evan at the door.
Hello, Evan. It's very nice to meet  you. (to Andrea) He's as handsome as his father.
(stunned) You know my father?
Before Dr. Redfield can answer, Andrea cuts him off.
That's why I wanted you to come here,  Evan. Dr. Redfield already has a  background in memory loss.
My father has a bad memory, too?
(off Andrea's look) Uh, tell you what, Evan. If it's  okay with your mother, I'd like to  run some tests. Nothing scary.
Evan raises an eyebrow at the doctor.
Okay, it might be a little scary...
Evan looks terrified as he lies on a medical platform as series of CAT-scan images are taken. In another part of t room, a distressed Andrea speaks quietly with Dr. Redfiel
Just tell me that Evan doesn't have  Jason's illness...
Look, Andrea, I'm sure he'll test  negative for brain disorders. But  there's something else you can try  to monitor his memory.
Anything.
A journal. Just have him write down  everything he does.
Why? What for?
It could be extremely useful to jog  his memory. See if he remembers  anything new the next day. And I'll  have the test results back in a few  days.
The next morning. Evan busily writes in his new black-mar mead comp book:

"Today Mommy is taking me to play with Kayley and Tommy. will mete there father and see what a real dad is like. M one day I will mete my Dad." Andrea, meanwhile, speaks into the phone as she pours Luc Charms into a cereal bowl for Evan.
Thanks, George. I really appreciate  you watching him, he won't be any  trouble at all.
Evan puts down the journal and eats breakfast. He separat the green clovers from the cereal and drops them to the f for Crockett to nibble.
These'll bring you luck, Crockett.
(into phone) Great. I'll see you soon.
Andrea hangs up the phone and walks into the next room.
Andrea grabs the pocket book off the coffee table and hea back into the kitchen. She drops her purse in shock when sees: Evan, in doorway, expressionless and holding a larg BUTCHER KNIFE by his side.
Evan?
Evan sees her but remains expressionless.
Evan? What are you doing with that  knife?
Life suddenly springs into Evan's face. He seems stunned find himself holding the knife and drops it.
(scared) What happened?
Honey. What were you doing with that?
(tears welling) I... I don't remember.
Andrea, still shaken, drops Evan off at the house of GEOR MILLER, 35, a handsome athletic man with an infectious sm He approaches the car and opens the door for Evan.
Hey, Andrea. (to Evan) Hello little man.
Andrea writes nervously on a piece of paper as Evan gets  out.
Thanks a lot George. Here's my work  number in case there are any problems.
(lighthearted laughter) Whaddaya kidding? We're going to  have a great time today, right Evan?
Andrea nods thanks and nervously drives away. Evan walks to Mr. Miller and momentarily reaches for his hand. Mr. M flinches his hand away and chuckles at Evan.
You waiting for an invitation? The  kids are inside.
Evan appears confused for a moment at Mr. Miller's unexpe rudeness, but walks inside.
Evan enters the well-kept middle class home and sees his  classmates Kayleigh and Tommy. Kayleigh is dressed in a m shift Medieval gown and Tommy is also dressed in a period costume.
(excited to see Evan) Evan, guess what? Dad got a new video  camera and we're all gonna be in a  movie.
I don't think Evan gets to be in it --
Quit it, Tommy. Evan gets to be Robin  Hood. I'm gonna be Maid Marian, and  you're the Sheriff of Nottingham!
I thought I was the bad guy!
You are, silly. He's a bad sheriff.
Mr. Miller, holding a full glass of scotch in one hand, s the circa-80's bulky video camera on a tripod and plugs i into the porta-deck.
We're really gonna be in a movie!?
That's right, Evan, and you get to  be the star.
I thought I was the star.
Shut up, moron. Now get in your  costume, Evan. And you have to  promise, your bestest super-duper  promise, that this will be our little  secret. Think you can do that?
Evan nods and sticks his arms straight up in the air. Mr. Miller downs his drink and helps Evan off with his clothe Suddenly --

Evan comes to in an unfamiliar place. The rec-room/baseme Evan's eyes dart from the fireplace to Mr. Miller's camer lens and finally to Kayleigh, whose ashen face trembles  slightly. Panic spreads across Evan's face.
Where am I? What happened? Where did  we all go?
Calm down, kid. Stand still.
Evan backs up and awkwardly scurries around the basement, grabbing his clothes. Panicking.
I was just somewhere else -- how did  I get here?
Quit acting like some retard or I'll  call your mother and tell her what a  naughty little shit you've been.
Kayleigh? What happened?
Kayleigh's eyes are unable to leave the floor. She begins adjusting her disheveled clothing. Evan trembles.
What's wrong with me?
Tommy silently watches from the top of the basement stair absently wringing the head off one of his sister's dolls.
Dr. Redfield places Evan's CAT-scan slides on the light b Andrea squints, unable to interpret them.
Well, the good news is that the  results are negative. I've found no  evidence in the way of lesions,  hemorrhaging, tumors...
And the bad news?
Unfortunately, we've got nothing to  work with. It's harder playing  detective now.
But you must have something to go  on?
If I had to guess, I'd say the  blackouts are stress related.
But he's seven. What kind of stress  can he have?
Plenty. Who knows? Maybe he's got  severe coping problems about not  having a father. Did you say the  last blackout occurred when he was  with his friend's dad.
Come on, I doubt the answer's that  simple.
You'd be surprised how often they  are.
Well, he has been pushing me to meet  his father, but I've been putting it  off.

It's worth a shot. I can arrange a  controlled meeting. A careful dose  of sedatives for Jason, some security,  you and I monitoring. Evan comes in  for a quick visit and with any luck,  no more missing father complex.
How soon?...
Evan, dressed in his Sunday best, writes copiously in a  journal marked "AGE 7."
"April 15. Today I get to mete my father. His name is Jas and he is crazy. I hope he lets me call him dad."
Andrea tightly grips Evan's hand as the pair follow Dr.  Redfield down a corridor. Evan's enthusiasm is dampened b the sounds of distant screams and bloodcurdling laughter.
Dad lives here?
Not in this wing, actually. No.
Now your father may seem sleepy to  you, but that's just because of his  medicine, okay?
Okay.
They walk to the end of the corridor and come to a "Visit Chamber". Dr.Redfield leads Evan inside. Andrea begins to follow, b the doctor gestures that she stay outside.

Evan takes a seat at a long rectangular table. His eyes a fixated on the door on the other side of the room. Finall a dark figure can be seen through the opaque glass. JASON, thirty and haggard looking, enters the room. His e want to sparkle at seeing his son for the first time. But tranquilizers have dulled the effect. Evan's eyes fixate on the leg-restraints and handcuffs th hinder Jason's movement. Finally Jason sits. He smiles warmly and speaks in over-enunciated tones.
It's okay. I won't bite. You've seen  pictures of me, right?
Uh-huh. Mom says I have your eyes  and your --

Evan "comes to" in another unfamiliar place. Rather than  seeing his father across a table, he's looking up at a  ceiling. Blocking his view of the ceiling is Jason, whose face is monstrous with rage, and whose cuffed hands are wrapped a Evan's throat, choking the life out of him.
(through clenched  teeth) I... love... you.
Suddenly, ORDERLIES tackle Jason from both sides and wedg baton under his jaw to wrench him away. Andrea franticall struggles to rescue Evan from Jason's clutches.
(panicking) He has to die! You don't understand!  It's the only way to stop it!

Jason wrestles the baton from under his chin, hits an ord in the kneecap and comes for Evan with the baton! Orderly #2 acts quickly, beating Jason with his baton. As Jason makes another desperate grab for Evan, Orderly #2 i forced to bash him in the skull. Down for the count. Andrea hugs Evan, now in shock.
I'm sorry, Evan. I'm sorry.
And ALARM sounds and Andrea tries to cover Evan's eyes, b through her fingers he can see a quick blur of a pool of  blood spreading from Jason's head.
Dressed in black, Andrea and Evan watch Jason's casket be lowered into the ground. Andrea's tears soak through her  veil. A few feet back, Kayleigh stands behind Evan.
Ashes to ashes... dust to dust.
Evan watches the coffin descend, disappearing from sight. Kayleigh steps up to Evan and takes his hand. A moment. A she softly whispers in Evan's ear.
You're better off anyway.
A rumble of thunder. Evan looks up at the brooding dark  clouds.
Gray skies. Andrea drives the children home. Evan stares the passing tombstones that flutter by like a white picke fence. The flickering strobe effect that intensifies into white blur is hypnotic.
Bright and sunny. The lawn freshly cut. A Toro lawnmower been carelessly left in the grass-strewn driveway.
CRANE DOWN to the window of the --

Evan, Kayleigh, Tommy and Lenny are now THIRTEEN. Evan ex cigarette smoke, taps his ash and finishes sketching a  portrait of Kayleigh in his journal. Tommy wears a leather jacket and now has traces of peach  fuzz on his upper lip. Kayleigh's hair is longer now, albeit stringy and unkempt Evan closes his journal and coolly ignites a STRIKE-ANYWH MATCH with his thumb and lights Kayleigh's cigarette. Eve but Lenny smokes in the basement. Tommy, now with longer hair, ransacks his father's army l looking for something.
Tommy, I'm bored shitless over here.  What's up already?
Hold your horses, man. It's here  somewhere. I saw it when I was a  kid.
Tommy absently chucks an old Playboy toward Lenny. Kaylei seems uncomfortable by the sight of it.
(to Tommy) We should go soon. If Dad catches us  smoking down here, we're dead.
So let's go. This place creeps me  out.
Evan claps his hands and stands up, Lenny and Kayleigh jo him. Finally, Tommy shakes an old army thermos and hears  something rattling inside.
I knew it had something to do with  the army.
Tommy opens the thermos, tips it over and a blockbuster ( stick of dynamite) spills out. Tommy grins mischievously.
Let's blow the shit out of something!
Tommy leads Evan, Kayleigh and Lenny on a mission through the woods. Everyone smokes except Lenny, yet he's the onl one who's wheezing. He pulls out an inhaler and takes a p
Guys, slow up, would you?
Evan, did I tell you? My mother said  I might be able to visit her this  summer in Orlando with her new family.
What did I say about mentioning that  bitch?
(uncomfortable) Where the hell are you taking us  anyway? Just blow something up  already.
Just blow something up? Are you nuts?  There's an art to mass destruction.  Would you just paint the Mona Lisa?  No. Besides, we're here already.
Now at the edge of the woods, Tommy spots:
A MAILBOX sits at the end of the driveway. It's exquisite An exact replica of a Colonial home it serves. Across the street, Tommy hands the blockbuster to Lenny.
Here you go, buddy.
(recoiling) What? No frigging way, man. I'm not  touching that thing.
The hell you aren't. Anyone of us  does it, you'll puss out and narc  for sure.
Ain't gonna work this time, buddy.  Look how small that fuse is! I'll  get killed.
Not necessarily.
All eyes turn to Evan as he takes his lit cigarette, brea off the filter and jams the fuse into the unlit end.
That should buy you ten minutes at  least.
Gee, thanks friend.

Lenny paces back and forth next to the three-story mailbo desperately trying to appear nonchalant. He pretends to n his shoe's untied and bends down to tie it. From the wood the other kids watch anxiously.
Oh, for Christ's sake, just do it,  Lenny.
Finally, Lenny throws the bomb in the mailbox. Then sprin like hell to the woods. Kayleigh shakes Lenny's inhaler a hands it to him when he gets back.
(taking puff) Thanks.
Evan pats Lenny on the back.
You got balls, man.

The four watch the mailbox in intense anticipation. Evan  smiles with the cigarette pressed tightly between his lip and places his hands over Kayleigh's ears. She smiles bac at him and presses his hands against her head. Tommy catc this and seems disturbed, and quickly turns back to -- The mailbox. Tick-tock... tick-tock... It's like a starin contest...
Evan, running full speed, comes to in an unfamiliar place He instantly loses his footing and falls to the ground. L falling on top of him.
Hurry! Let's go! Get him up, Evan!  Come on!
(frantic) What happened?? Where are we?!

Evan gets up and starts running, then realizes he's not b followed. Kayleigh and Tommy are helping Lenny up and car him. Evan realizes that Lenny's completely dazed. Evan do back, grabs Lenny's arm and he and Tommy drag Lenny throu the woods as fast as they can.
(crying) Oh God... what did we do?
Shit, Lenny. What's happened to you!  We've gotta get help!

Andrea's car screeches to the curb of Lenny's house. Lenn mother, Mrs. Kagan, frantically loads Lenny into an ambul As Andrea rushes up to the ambulance, Mrs. Kagan gives he an icy glare and slams the ambulance door in Andrea's fac Andrea turns to Evan, now trembling on the front stoop.
What is it? What happened?
(staring menacingly  at the others) We were just building a fort in the  woods when Lenny freaked out. One  minute he was fine, then he just  froze up. Right guys?
What happened, Evan? The truth.
I don't know... I don't remember.
Something must've happened! What set  him off?
I... I blacked out.
(building frustration) Don't try to use your blackouts to  get out of this one!
Evan looks helpless.
You're not making this up, are you?
Evan shakes his head "no". Almost ashamed...
Evan lies on a couch.
With every breath you exhale, you  can feel all of the tension draining  from your body like water through a  faucet. Nine, ten, and you're  completely asleep. Relaxed.
Evan breathes slowly. Deeply. Andrea watches nervously fr the far side of the room.
Now I want you to go back to the  time you were in the woods with Lenny.  Think of it like a movie. You can  pause, rewind, or slow down any  details you wish. Understand?
Yes.
Where are you now?
I'm standing next to Kayleigh, my  hands are over her ears.
Are you hurting her?
No, protecting her.
Andrea suppresses the tiniest of proud smiles.
Okay. Then go a little forward in  time. What do you see now?
I see a car.
Evan's eyes suddenly roll back in his head.
Yes, tell me about the car.
Evan moans and begins shaking.
Go on. Nothing can hurt you. Remember,  this is only a movie. You're  completely safe.
(moaning) I can't... the car vanishes and all  of a sudden I'm on the ground in the  woods.
The car doesn't vanish Evan. The  movie in your head has broken, that's  all. But now I've re-spliced it and  I want you to tell me about the car.
It's coming... argh! I can't!
Evan moans and shakes on the couch.
Fight it Evan. Hurry. It's coming!
Blood begins to trickle from Evan's nose as a guttural so is uttered from deep within him. Dr. Redfield bolts uprig in his chair and redirects the session.
Okay, Evan. Listen to my voice! On  the count of ten, you're going to  wake up. Feeling refreshed and  remembering everything we talked  about.
Evan moans in agony. Andrea darts into the room.
What's happening to him?? Make it  stop!
Dr. Redfield waves her away and concentrates on Evan.
One. You're feeling more awake now.  Two, your eyes no longer feel heavy.
Andrea moves to stop the blood flowing from Evan's nose. lifts Evan's eyelids and sees only the whites of his eyes
Five. Six. Refreshed and awake! Seven,  eight. Come on, Evan, wake up, dammit!
Evan is completely non-responsive.
Evan wake up, oh please wake up!
Nine, ten. And you're awake! Open  your eyes, dammit!

Nothing but moans and blood. Dr. Redfield frantically ope some desk drawers until he finds smelling salts. He break small capsule under evan's mouth, pinches his bleeding no closed and lets Evan inhale the vapor through his mouth. Evan lurches forward on the couch and falls off. Holding bloody nose.
What happened? Did it work?
Evan deduces the answer from everyone's horrified faces.
Andrea drops off Evan, Kayleigh and Tommy outside the com Kayleigh, looking morose, shuts the car door and Andrea d off. They walk through the parking lot.
(to Kayleigh) Wipe that sad-assed look off your  face before you get us all busted.  You see the way Evan's mom was looking  at you?
I'm sorry.
Would someone just tell me already  what the hell happened in the mailbox?
On "mailbox", Tommy suddenly grabs Evan's jacket and SHOV him against a parked car. Tommy looks around to make sure nobody heard anything.
Don't ever bring that shit up again.  Not ever. Not to me, not to Kayleigh,  or even Lenny. The stupid fuck if he  ever learns to talk again. Understand?
Evan nods, scared. Tommy gives a final shove.
Ever. (re: Kayleigh) She don't want to talk about it,  anyway. Do you Kayleigh?
Tommy's right. Kayleigh clearly doesn't.
Kayleigh shuffles behind Evan and Tommy as they head towa the theatre. Evan drops back.
Are you okay?
Kayleigh says nothing as Tommy sees the theatre playing S and whispers.
There it is. Let's go.
Andrea does the dishes as the TV plays a NEWSCAST in the  b.g.
(on TV) ...was the grizzly aftermath of what  police officials of upstate New York  are calling a horrible act of  vandalism gone awry.
Andrea turns to the TV, blocking our view. We can only he the report as she watches intensely.
The powerful explosion is believed  to have been caused by a small  quantity of dynamite.
Andrea's face looks haunted by the on-screen images. She  shakes her head in terror and grabs the remote.
Police thus far have no leads as to  the suspects...
She clicks off the TV, trembling.
The movie's in progress. Evan and Kayleigh sit behind Tom
Holy shit! Look at that fat fuck!  You'd have to wipe his ass with a  forklift!
Some crowd members TURN around and give Tommy a SHUSH. To whips M&Ms at them.
Shut up, faggot. No one's talking to  you!
Kayleigh, repulsed, suddenly darts from the aisle and run out. Evan follows.
Evan follows her to a small alcove.
I'm sorry Kayleigh. This was a bad  idea.
You really don't remember anything  that happened?
Evan shakes his head "no". She looks devastated.
You're so lucky.
She begins to cry. Evan makes sure no one's staring.
It's going to be okay. Lenny'll be  fine. You'll see.
He reaches to comfort her. But she winces.
Ouch.
I'm sorry.
She pulls her sleeve up, revealing a large bruise.
It's not your fault. Mrs. Kagan called  dad and blamed us for what happened  to Lenny.
Damn. Your dad did this?
Kayleigh pulls back her shirt collar to show an even larg darker bruise.
(looking down) I deserve a lot worse.
What are you talking about? What you  deserve is a better brother and  father. All they do is make you feel  like shit.
She looks into his eyes.
You really have no clue how beautiful  you are, do you?
She searches his eyes for sincerity. And finds it. They l into each other for a TENDER KISS. After a moment, a ROAR from nearby.
What the fuck are you doing??
They jerk back to see Tommy, shocked and betrayed, starin at them from across a small crowd. By now, some teens chu at Tommy.
Buying popcorn, what the fuck are  you doing?

Tommy rushes through the small crowd at Evan. His hands i fists. Suddenly a FOOT reaches out and trips Tommy. Tommy falls to the floor and the crowd cackles at him. Tommy slowly gets up, locks eyes with Evan. Hatred oozing Evan looks guilty, weakly shaking his head, it's not what you're thinking. Tommy suddenly lunges at the TEEN PUNK who must be at lea a foot taller than he is. Tommy lands a flurry of punches before the Teen Punk can even defend himself, frequently  taking opportunities to eyeball Evan. Evan, Kayleigh and even the punk's FRIENDS look on helple when TWO SECURITY GUARDS SEIZE TOMMY. Tommy valiantly  struggles against them at first. But the moment he realiz it's hopeless, he allows his body to go slack. As Tommy is being dragged away, he turns to Evan, a sick  smile on his face.  Evan and Kayleigh look back, speechle
Andrea drives through the winding roads.

Andrea's eyes. Tormented. REVEAL she's driving Evan and Kayleigh home. Evan's up fr and Kayleigh sits behind them. Everyone silent. Andrea stares through the rearview mirror into Kayleigh's eyes. Probing. Searching.
So how was the movie?
Okay.
Andrea watches Kayleigh. A calculated beat.
Any exploding mailboxes?
Kayleigh flinches at the question. And Andrea catches it. Evan can't help but look back at Kayleigh. Oh my god, she knows.
(faking poorly) What do you mean?
Andrea pulls the car over and stops. After a moment, Kayl realizes she's at her house. She exits the car in a hurry
Goodnight.
Andrea stares at Evan, who keeps his eyes facing dead ahe She finally shifts the car into gear.
We're moving.
Evan says nothing.
A "For Sale" sign is now planted on the front lawn. Andre in her nurse uniform, exits the house to her car.
Evan discreetly watches her leave through the window. Gra his coat and exits frame.
Kayleigh and Evan walk down toward the house.

Lenny, silhouetted by the sky, seems to vibrate violently if operating a jack-hammer.
Evan comes to in a familiar place. His original college d ONLY BACKWARDS.
Christ. Help me.
He sits upright in bed and takes in his surroundings. Whe suddenly, Evan clutches his head in severe pain.
Color memories of Kayleigh's sorority fade to BLACK and W and dissipate.
Memories of Evan's vandalized car fade to BLACK and WHITE and dissipate.
The faces of Karl and Rick all turn grainy...
As new images of THUMPER become more BRILLIANT.
A new image overwhelms the others: Lenny, 13, with dark,  soulless eyes wearing a straight-jacket in a padded room.
Evan's eyes roll back in his head. He shakes uncontrollab and blood pours from his nose. Thumper opens the door, sees Evan convulsing and jumps ba in horror. He scans the hallways for assistance.
Someone call 9-1-1!
Evan lies on an examining table undergoing another series CAT-scans. The machines are now state of the art and the room has been redecorated.
Andrea nervously chews her fingernails as she watches Dr. Redfield post CAT-scan results on the light box. A young  nurse pushes Evan, in a wheelchair, into the doctor's off
Okay, doc. What's the damage? How  much time have I got?
Cute, Evan.
It's a little complicated. I haven't  seen results exactly like these  before.
Are you sure? Not even with my father?
Dr. Redfield and Andrea exchange looks.
Actually, these tests weren't  available twenty years ago.
So what did you find.
Dr. Redfield points to the CAT-scan slides, specifically, the outer lining of Evan's brain.
This is where we're finding most of  the hemorrhaging. The outer lining  of the cerebral cortex.
(nonplussed) Lemme guess. Would that be where the  memories are stored?
Dr. Redfield stares ahead. Transfixed by the slides.
I've never seen anything like this.  I've compared these to the ones taken  last year, and there's evidence of  severe hemorrhaging and massive neural  reconstruction.
Andrea stares at him blankly. Evan impatiently "pops whee in the wheel chair.
What does that mean for Evan?
(to Andrea) He's saying it's like forty years  worth of new memories have been jammed  in my brain since last year. Overload  city. 'Sat about the gist of it,  doc?
Dr. Redfield nods, awed by Evan's effortless interpretati Evan springs out of the wheelchair and stretches his legs
(to Andrea) Mind if I wait in the car? The  lighting here bugs my eyes.
Andrea nods. Evan shakes Dr. Redfield's hand.
Well, it's nice seeing you again.  But you know, people to see, things  to read...
Andrea shoots Dr. Redfield an apologetic look. Evan heads out the door, accidentally knocking Dr. Redfield's jacket the floor. He shrugs apologetically and re-hangs it.

Outside the office, Evan inspects Dr. Redfield's KEYS and attached SECURITY CARD and smiles. Evan covertly winds hi through the maze of corridors, careful not to be seen by staff. He finally sees a wing marked "CRIMINALLY INSANE". Evan l around to make certain he's not being watched, then uses security card to open the door. He looks in every room of the wing until he finds --

Evan unlocks the door and is moved by what he sees. Lenny is strapped onto a metal bed, his arms and legs in  tight leather restraints. The dark five o'clock shadow an his malicious grin radiate evil. His black and haunting eyes personify hate and murderous  intent. Lenny seems neither surprised or happy to see Evan. That if he's aware of Evan's presence at all...
Is there anything you need? Anything  I can get you?
Nothing from Lenny.
What about the models, man? Bet I  can get you a shitload of models up  in here.
Still nothing. Not even a glance in his direction. Evan s and gives up.
Okay, Lenny. Just wanted to say "hi".
Evan turns around to leave.
You knew the whole time, didn't you? (Evan spins around) When you put the blade in my hand,  you knew something big was going to  happen. Didn't you?!
(jaw dropped) Y... yes. I guess I did.
Lenny's eyes seethe with hate.
Then you should be where I am. You  should be where I am.
Evan backs away, face guilt-stricken.
Evan enters his dormroom (where everything's backwards),  reaches under his bed and is relieved to find the journal marked "AGE 7".
Evan is ignored by several Theta Chi pledges as he plops  himself by a tree and hunts through his journal to find t entry from when he was seven and visited Jason at Sunnyva
"Today I get to mete my father. His name is Jason and he crazy. I hope he lets me call him dad." Evan takes a calming breath and begins reading.
(as if reciting a  mantra) Today I get to meet my father. His  name is Jason and he is crazy...
Evan gets some strange looks, but continues. As he does, trees and frisbee-playing students behind him VIBRATE and SHUDDER.
Seven-year old Evan comes to during the time he first met his father, Jason. Jason waits patiently for young Evan to finish his senten
Are you okay? You looked like you  were somewhere else for a second  there.
Look, Jason, I need some fast answers  if I'm ever gonna fix what I've done.
Jason is completely thrown.
I was praying this curse would have  ended with me.
But it didn't. And now I need info  to make things right again and you're  the only one who can give it to me.
(frustrated) There is no "right". When you change  who people are, you destroy who they  were.
Who's to say you can't make things  better?
Jason seems extremely upset to hear Evan say this.
You can't play God, son. It must end  with me. Just by being here, you may  be killing your mother.
Bullshit. I'll send you a postcard  when I've made everything perfect  again.
Jason launches himself across the table, shackles and all and grabs hold of Evan's throat.
As Jason looks down at us, frothing at the mouth, there's trick of the light where Jason's head seems to VIBRATE ag the ceiling.
Evan's hands instinctively reach for his throat, then he  realizes his surroundings. Heartbroken, he shuts the jour and stands up shakily.
Evan eats in the same diner where Kayleigh used to work. he eats, his arm sits in front of his plate, protectively Guarding his food.
Just get out, didja?
Huh?
(re: his arm) Nothing. Just that my brother did a  stint in the pen and he used to eat  like that.
(defensively) I come from a big family.
Meant no offense.
None taken. Hey, uh, does Kayleigh  Miller still work here?
(confused) Sorry. Never heard of her.
Evan slowly walks up the driveway, which is now a dilapid mess. Garbage litters the front lawn and paint chips rot the sides of the house. Inside, Mr. Miller yells at someo
Just shut the hell up already! Can't  a man get a little goddman peace in  his own home! (Evan rings doorbell) Oh, for Christ's sake, now what?
Mr. Miller opens the door and sees Evan.
Don't suppose you're here to sell  cookies?
In a blur, Evan grabs Mr. Miller's shirt and violently sh him through the house and into a wall.
Good guess, fuckbag. (off Miller's startled  face) Remember me now? We had a great chat  once when I was seven.
Mr. Miller goes slack, his eyes wide with horror.
One question, fuckbag. Where can I  find your daughter?
Evan walks past some junkies and enters.

Evan steps over some passed out bodies that litter the ha of an incredibly seedy motel. The kind with hourly rates. knocks on a door. Kayleigh, now haggard, strung-out junkie, opens the door immediately the contempt for Evan grows in her eyes. She  puts out an expression of disappointment.
Oh, I thought you were my eight  o'clock. Make it fast, I'm expecting  someone.
Nice to see you, too. Can I come in?
She looks around, waves him in.
If I knew you were coming I'd have  cleaned the stains off the sheets.
The room is dirty and sparse, excepting charred-bottom sp yellowed cotton balls and brown-spotted squares of tin fo Evan doesn't hesitate to sit on the "soiled" bed.
What do you want?
Evan can't speak. His eyes begin to water.
I just needed to see... a friendly  face.
His sincerity touches her.
Well, time is money, Evan. So you...
Evan reaches for his wallet and throws it on her dresser. Kayleigh eyes the wallet. But makes no move to pick it up
Well, I guess I can spare ten minutes  for an old friend, right?
Tears fall freely from Evan's eyes.
So how's tricks? Sorry, occupational  humor.
I get it. You can drop it now.
(angry again) Oh, I'm sorry. Does my line of work  make you uncomfortable, precious?
No. Just that you need to hurt me  with it. I've been where you've been.
Ha! Where's that?
The bottom. When you're just a piece  of meat waiting for the next attack.
Kayleigh watches Evan silently.
What's happened to you?
You wouldn't believe me. I mean,  people always say, "You wouldn't  believe me", but in this case, it's  not even worth trying.
I've seen some sickening shit. I  don't blink twice anymore, especially  in your case.
Why's that?
Because you're... different.
Different? How?
Let me ask you a question. Just a  little one that's been gnawing at me  for years.
Yeah?
On the bridge. How did you know that  Tommy had your dog? That was no  fucking hunch.
Do you remember when I was a kid and  I had those blackouts?
Evan continues and Kayleigh listens with a mixture of int interest and matched skepticism.
Kayleigh finishes a plateful of food at a busy diner. She lights up an after-dinner smoke.
You're right, Evan, I don't believe  you.
I never thought you would. That's  why I've never bothered to tell a  soul until now, and why I never will  again.
I'm the only person you've told?  That's a great line. Does that make  other girls swoon? Do they actually  eat up this bullshit?
I couldn't give a shit if you believe  me or not, and frankly I'm too tired  to prove it to you.
Oh? There's proof now?
(tired) Shit. I dunno. How would I know about  the twin moles on your inner thigh?
Anyone with fifty bucks could tell  you that.
Then forget that. How about... you  prefer the smell of a skunk to  flowers, you hate cilantro because  for reasons unknown to you, it reminds  you of your step-sister.
Kayleigh's jaw drops.
Oh! And when you orgasm, your toes  go numb. I'm sure your clientele  aren't privy to that one.
Kayleigh tries to conceal the surprise in her eyes.
I just thought you should know.
Know what?
That I didn't leave you there to  rot.
Kayleigh flinches as if her should had been invaded, then her eyes fill with distrust and contempt.
There's one major hole in your story.
Which is?
There is no fuckin' way on this planet  or any other that I was in some  fuckin' sorority.
She opens Evan's wallet and leaves a twenty on the table.
Sure you don't want your wallet?
Don't think I'll need it where I'm  going.
Off to change everyone's life again,  is that it? Maybe this time you'll  pop up in some mansion while I wind  up in Tijuana doing the donkey act.
I'm over it. Whenever I try to help  anyone it all turns to shit.

Well, don't give up now, Slick. You've  already done so much for me. Hell,  why don't you go back in time and  save Mrs. Halpern and her baby. Then  maybe Lenny wouldn't freak out and  ruin my family.
She gets up and puts on her coat.
Oh, here's one! Go back when I'm  seven and fuck me in front of Daddy's  handicam, you know, straighten me  out a bit...
She tosses his wallet over her shoulder at him and leaves
Evan enters his familiar looking dorm and hears the famil sounds of Thumper having sex with another naked GOTHIC CO ED. On Evan's bed.
Get out. Both of you.
Sorry, dude. Just figured it'd be  okay with you bein' sick and all.
Evan's temper flares and he picks up a chair and SMASHES against a wall above Thumper's head.
I'm not saying it again.

Thumper and the co-ed quickly cover themselves in the bla and leave. Alone in the room, Evan looks under his bed an breathes a sigh of relief to see all of his journals are  intact. He sifts through them again. He finally finds the passage he needs. Something catches the corner of Evan's  eyes and he turns to examine it. To the left of Thumper's Buddha statuette sits a large VO CANDLE that bears a portrait of Jesus Christ.
(humble) Lord give me the strength and guidance  I need to set things right.
As he begins reading a passage to himself, SOUNDS ECHO  backward at us from another time and place. And the entir ROOM SHIMMERS around him --

Evan comes to as he, Kayleigh, Lenny and Tommy -- all thi watch Mrs. Halpern carry her baby back to the mailbox acr the street with intense anticipation. Evan suddenly comes life and makes himself visible, running across the street shouting.
Lady, stay back! Don't go near the  mailbox!
Mrs. Halpern, startled, stares at the young kid skeptical as she absently continues toward the mailbox.
I mean it, woman! Get the hell back!
Lenny comes running across the street to Evan's aid, and  Tommy shrugs and follows after him.
There's a bomb in the mailbox. Get  away!

Tommy, still running, cringes to hear Lenny's stupid  confession and rolls his eyes at the situation. Evan posi himself between Mrs. Halpern and the mailbox, frantically waving his hand at her to stay back, because she's STILL  COMING.
I'll save you lady!
Tommy takes a running dive at Mrs. Halpern, perhaps a bit too hard, and sends her and the baby to the pavement, hur but no major injuries. Seeing things are safe, Evan backs away from the mail --
The blast is deafening! Evan's body is hurled backwards  dramatically.
Evan comes to back in his dorm, the same posters are on t wall, the sheets are the same. Even the familiar sounds o Thumper having sex under the covers.
I thought I told you two to beat it.
Evan's face falls as he hears a familiar voice, but not  Thumper's.
What? Hey, sorry, man. We wake you  up?
Evan is confused by Lenny's presence, but smiles to himse and shakes his head "no".
No, it's cool. (re: Lenny's okay) Really cool.
Evan yawns, bringing his hand to his mouth, but there's n hand. No arm, really, either. Just two FLESHY STUMPS! Evan bolts upright in bed and stares down at his amputati

head_text.subj: A FLOOD OF MEMORIES ASSAULT HIM

text: We see countless and brief image flashes of Evan growing from the age of thirteen with NO ARMS, and requiring a  WHEELCHAIR.
Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and drinks onto Evan's la as Lenny pushes the wheelchair.
Evan celebrates his 14th birthday and blows out the candl Andrea, Kayleigh, Tommy and Lenny all clap.
Tommy pushes Evan to church.
Evan screams as blood pours from his nose. Lenny is out o bed at once to help him... as is KAYLEIGH! (Now beautiful and natural looking).
Lenny and Kayleigh, as teens, sit together with Evan at t far end of the boat.
Evan looks on longingly as Lenny and Kayleigh become love in high school.
A campfire. Evan sips from a BEER CAP as Lenny and Kaylei make out in plain sight with Tommy's bashful approval.

Evan's in agony as Kayleigh opens a series of dorm doors Lenny rushes Evan's wheelchair through. Kayleigh carries pair of prosthetic arms in her hands. Evan moans and tries to rub his temple with his stump.
Where are we going?
We have to get you to Sunnyvale.  You're having one of your famous  hemorrhages.
Stop! Take me back!
Sorry, tough guy, no can do. Your  mother would kill me.

Evan launches his body forward and spills clumsily out of the wheelchair. Lenny must halt in order not to crush Eva As Evan writhes about on the floor, his legs paralyzed, a CROWD GATHERS. Evan focuses on Lenny, but it's hard to ignore the crowd  that titters and snickers in the background.
Take me back, Lenny! (teeth clenched) You owe me that much.
Kayleigh turns to face the jeering crowd.
What are you geeks looking at? Must  be nice to be so goddamned perfect,  huh? Fucking losers.
The crowd breaks up and leaves.
It's calm now. Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan's wheelchair  around the quad. Evan now wears prosthetic arms. Random P call out to Lenny. He's extremely popular in this world.
'Sup, Sheila! We missed you at the  party! Don't even think I'm giving  you my lab notes either! Think I  like getting up for "eight thirty's"?
Lenny pushes Evan past Thumper and Cricket. Their convers stops and they stare at their feet as Evan gets wheeled b Evan boils to be treated as if he were non-existent.
Hey, there's Tommy.

Evan spins around in fear. He sees Tommy, clean-cut, and  handing out flyers in front of a banner that reads "Campu Crusade for Christ." Tommy seems good-natured now, workin hard and soliciting names for his list. He looks up as Ev rolls along and his eyes brighten to see Evan.
I did what you said, man! We're  pooling our student funds with Hillel  House and we're going to have an  Awareness Dance.
Oh goody, nothing like spinning my  chair around to a techno mix of Hava  Nagila til I puke.
Tommy frowns and exchanges glances with Lenny, who shrugs and nods back to him.
Uh, we should be getting to class  now.
Forget it. What's the point of Psych  now? Tomorrow I could wake up as  some dirt farmer in Bangladesh.
Another exchanged glance. Kayleigh looks at Evan.
Let's go for a stroll.
Evan allows Kayleigh to roll him away from the others. To the very spot where Evan once killed Tommy. Evan stares at his prosthetic hand which he can "magicall will to open, close, open, close...
So Tommy's really into this Jesus  kick, huh?
Kayleigh looks at him curiously.
You know how spiritual he's gotten  ever since he saved Mrs. Halpern and  Katie.
He saved Mrs. Halpern? Please, the  twisted fuck.

Kayleigh, now by a bench. Stops and sits. As she casually uses her foot to turn his chair to face her, she pulls ou granola bar and hands it to him. His prosthetic hand crushes it. It crumbles to dust. She  seems more confused.
Is something the matter?
(re: prosthetic arms) Yeah, I think I gotta get these fixed  or something.
She leans into him, gently feeding him her remaining bar.
Kayleigh? Do you ever think about  "us?" I mean, wonder if it could  ever have been different between the  two of us?
Sure, Evan, why not? You were the  first person I really ever cared  about.
I was?
That's why when I was little I never  went to live with my mother.
I don't get it.
(feeding another bite) When my folks split, they gave me  and Tommy a choice who we wanted to  live with. I couldn't stand my dad,  but I knew if I moved to my mom's  I'd never see you again.
I never knew that. So then you still  sometimes think of us... together?
It's crossed my mind from time to  time.
(hopeful) And...?

Well a lot of things cross my mind.  I've always been a fast thinker, Ev.  I can play out the movie of our entire  lives in under a second. Boom -- we  fall in love -- get married -- two  kids, your keen analytical insight  matched to my generous nature --  kids grow old as do we, relatively  stable relationships, matching burial  plots, the whole bit. It took a lot  longer to spit out than to imagine.
Then you think it might have worked  out?
Why not? But that's not how things  wound up. I'm with Lenny, Lenny's  your friend. And there it ends.
She looks into his eyes and shrugs almost apologetically. Tears streak down Evan's face as he speaks in a pleading  tone.
Would it make any difference if I  told you that no one could possibly  love anyone as much as I love you?
Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. E turns to see Lenny waving her over. She puts her hand on  Evan's shoulder, stands and goes to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her.
Lenny kissing Kayleigh. In painful slo-mo. Evan turns awa utterly heartbroken.
Evan's stump turns on a BATHTUB FAUCET.

Evan, fully clothed, lies in a bathtub that's filling wit water. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped ove The water rises past his mouth, to his nostrils -- Evan m his peace and takes a final breath. And the water spills over the side of the tub. All Evan c do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. A beat. Then the door opens. TOMMY ENTERS. Immediately sizing up the situation.
You forgot to put the toaster on the  edge.
Tommy casually turns off the water, then pops open the DR The water level lowers to Evan's mouth.
But you, Kayleigh and Lenny like  toast. And that's really all that  matters now.

Tommy feels Evan's anguish and plops his ass on the wet f by the tub. He lays his head onto Evan's shoulder. Evan bristles at first, but finally gives in to his hatre ultimately resting his own head against Tommy's. Taking t comfort offered.
I'll get you changed. Visiting hours  are almost up.
Tommy rolls Evan through a quiet hospital corridor.
(looking around) What, did mom get transferred again?
Tommy frowns, confused, then rolls Evan into --

Evan is startled to see Andrea hooked up to several IV's, oxygen tank and a respirator. Several oxygen hoses connec to a tracheotomy tube. Tommy smiles and kisses Andrea on the cheek. She tousles hair in return. Evan can hardly speak. As Tommy begins to wheel Evan's ch closer to Andrea's bedside, Andrea utters a faint whisper
Looking. Good. Kiddo.
Evan eyes her MEDICAL CLIPBOARD as he's wheeled by.
(reading) Lung cancer?
Sorry, Mrs. T. He's been out of sorts  lately.
Andrea flinches to hear this. Evan stares at her, eyes wi
Right... You started chain smoking  after I blew myself up.
Evan suddenly seems sick with guilt.
There must be a way to fix this.
Fix?
I just need the entry about the  blockbuster. Wait, shit, no arms. I  never even got the chance to write  it.
A flicker of recognition registers in her eyes.
Is Evan... different?
He's just going through some tough  times.
Mom. Don't cry. I can change this.
I think I'll go check out the chapel.
You're. Acting. Like your father.
Come on, Mom. Just 'cause Dad was my  age when he started going crazy  doesn't mean that I'm nuts.
Andrea is shocked.
How. Did you. Know that?
You told me that on Parents' Weekend.  Remember? Wait, that wasn't me. Or  you.
She uses her left hand to pinch off the air to her oxygen tube and forces herself to speak in a sick, GRAVELY manne
Just. Like. Jason.
Don't worry. I'm gonna get you out  of here.
He pushes a lever and the mechanical wheelchair rolls its out of the room. Andrea forces her loudest raspy scream.
Stop him. Stop him. Stop him...
Lenny tears through old cardboard boxes in Evan's closet. Evan watches nearby.
Are you sure you even packed it?
My mom packed for me. I think she  sent everything I ever owned. So  we'll see.
Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's jun on the floor. Old report cards, books, toys and photo alb fall on the floor.
Is this it?
Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. AG 7.
What do you need it for? I don't get  you lately.
Duly noted. Now I'm gonna ask you  for one last favor.
What?
Shhh. I need to concentrate on the  blockbuster if I'm gonna destroy it.
(concerned) Destroy it?
If I hadn't blown my arms off, Mom  never woulda started smoking in the  first place. Now shhhh.
Lenny, utterly baffled, sits back in silence and watches  Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat.
As new sounds ECHO BACKWARD. There's a --
Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen. He is only seven  years old. He coughs up Lucky Charms that have "magically appeared in his mouth. On a journal before him is the rec written passage:

"Today Mommy is taking me to play with Kayley and Tommy. will mete there father and see what a real dad is like." Andrea is nowhere in sight. Evan springs to his feet and  flexes his real hands triumphantly.
Yes. Now how do I destroy the  blockbuster?

He rummages through the utensil drawer and pulls out a la butcher knife and grabs it. He tucks it into his sock but won't fit. He's still debating what to do when: ANDREA WALKS IN and is startled by the unexpected sight o Evan holding a huge knife. Evan sees her but remains expressionless. Andrea's face  blanches.
Evan? What are you doing with that  knife?
Evan comes to to find Lenny still staring at him. Waiting for something big to happen.
Well, that didn't work...
Evan flips a single page of his journal and tries again. reads to himself, then relaxes his head --
Evan, seven again, stands in the basement dressed in his  Robin Hood costume as Mr. Miller prepares for the sex sce
Now in this part of the story, Robin  Hood just married Maid Marian and  they have to kiss and stuff like  grown-ups do.
Kayleigh giggles. There seems to be a new glint of  intelligence in Evan's eyes as he adjusts to his new  surroundings.
Wait! I need my belt!
Mr. Miller is puzzled, but watches Evan SKIP to the firep
(overly childlike) Loo loo, skip to my loo. Loo loo,  skip to my loo.
Mr. Miller puts his eye back to the viewfinder as Evan qu finds Mr. Miller's old army thermos in the bottom drawer the dresser, opens it and shakes out the blockbuster.
Loo, loo, skip to my loo.
He tries to crack it with his own hands, but his seven-ye old body is too weak.
Hey kid, don't bother with the belt.
Mr. Miller finally turns around and sees Evan banging the blockbuster on the table. Shock registers in Mr. Miller's eyes and he takes a step towards Evan.
Back off, fuckbag!
Mr. Miller freezes on that, and Evan smiles at him.
Amazing. That word never fails to  make an impression with you...
Mr. Miller takes a slow, non-threatening step toward Evan
Easy does it, Evan! Don't be a bad  boy or I'll tell mommy you were  naughty.
And I'll tell the Child Protective  Services about your kiddie porn  endeavors. One step closer and I'll  shove this up your ass!

Kayleigh's mouth hangs open with utter amazement at the s Tommy, hiding at the top of the stairs, slowly creeps dow to get a better view. Evan rummages in the bureau and finds the wooden "strike  anywhere" matches used at thirteen to light his cigarette
That's dangerous! You could blow  your hands off!
Been there, done that.

Evan, standing near the fireplace, defiantly strikes the  match with this thumb and lowers the flame to the short f Mr. Miller charges Evan just as the fuse is lit! Mr. Mill knocks the blockbuster from Evan's hand and it rolls towa the other side of the room, resting peacefully against th video camera. Kayleigh's eyes are dazzled by the sparkling fuse and she bends down to pick it up --
Kayleigh! NOOOOOooooo!
BOOM! The blast is deafening.
Evan, twenty, wakes up with a bloody nose.
Oh God, Kayleigh...
Evan gets a new series of QUICK IMAGES and FLASHED FACES.
Evan (now seven) is institutionalized before a judge.
Evan (seven through twelve) GROWS UP in an institution.
Evan undergoes years of therapy under Redfield's care.
Evan lies in a room, same posters from college adorn the  walls. Blood flows freely now.
(sobbing uncontrollably) Kayleigh... no! You can't die again!  I won't let this happen. I won't!
Evan fights off the pain and looks under his bed for  something.
Where are they?!
His journals are missing! He runs from the room.
Evan runs into Dr. Redfield's office just as another pati is leaving.
Hey, Evan. What's the big rush? We  don't meet for another hour.
Where are my goddamn books?
Books?
My journals! Where are they?
The doctor looks heartbroken, as if Evan has had a relaps
It kills me to have to go through  this again. There are no journals.  There never were. It's part of this  fantasy world your mind created to  cope with the guilt of killing...
Evan looks stunned. Refusing to believe it.
Think Evan. You've invented a disease  that doesn't exist. Alternate  universes with colleges, prisons,  paraplegia...
But I... I need those books.
You remind me of your father. He  always screamed for a photo album  even though he never had one.
Photos?
Evan's eyes roll back and he collapses lifelessly to the  floor.
Evan lies on a platform and gets another series of CAT-sc
Evan, no longer incapacitated, stares out the window into the darkness. Alone. Trapped. Hopeless.
Later that day, Dr. Redfield posts the new CAT-scan slide on the light box and shudders when he sees the results. A looks on anxiously.
Jesus, no.
Andrea, biting her nails, is unable to conceal her fear.
No dances, just tell me.
(devastated) The hemorrhaging... the neural damage  is irreparable. I'm frankly surprised  he still has use of his motor  functions.

Andrea begins to break down in tears. Evan secretly liste in from the hallway. His gaunt face looks deep in thought. He takes a breath a enters the lab, making sure not to look directly at his  weeping mother.
Hey, Mom, didja remember to bring  those goofy old home movies we used  to make?
Andrea wipes tears away, nodding in advance.
